Open Space – Ipswich County Library timetable for 27 June - 19 September 2018

Written by Sarah Lungley · Published Jun 25, 2018

Here is the new timetable for Open Space at Ipswich County Library for 27 June - 19 September 2018! Lots of exciting things coming up and some great discussions.

If you have any questions please do get in touch, or just come along to a session on Wednesdays at Ipswich County Library– all are welcome!

Running order: lunch/tea/coffee → informal discussion topic or activity → tea/coffee. You can come and just listen if you prefer and drop in and out as you please.

When possible, a member of staff will remain at the library during trips for those who don’t wish to go

Date Topic
27.06.18 Activity: arts and crafts - create a self-portrait
04.07.18 Activity: TBC
11.07.18 Discussion: Why do humans feel sadness and how can we cope with it?
18.07.18 Activity: Walk to Christchurch Mansion with optional rounders game
25.07.18 Discussion: How can we make sure Open Space is a welcoming place for all?
01.08.18 Discussion: 5 Ways to Wellbeing
08.08.18 Discussion: What has made you feel proud? Bring a memento or photo to share.
15.08.18 Discussion: What is it like to feel paranoid or unsafe around others? What can help and what can hinder?
22.08.18 Activity: TBC
29.08.18 Activity: picnic in Christchurch Park
05.09.18 Activity: Quiz
12.09.18 Discussion: Stress. How can it affect us mentally and physically? What can we do to reduce it?
19.09.18 Activity: Historical walk aronund Ipswich

Sarah Lungley

I'm the mental health and wellbeing coordinator at Suffolk Libraries.

About

My name is Sarah Lungley and I am the coordinator for Suffolk Libraries Mental Health and Wellbeing Information Service.

My role is to help provide information on local services and to promote events in our libraries and the community that can support mental health and wellbeing.

The service also aims to support our library staff, to ensure they are able to access useful and up-to-date information for our customers should they request it.

Libraries are a fantastic resource, not only for books and information but for community, friendships and fun too. So pop in to your local branch or explore our website to find out more about what we do – we hope to see you soon!
